org.webcycle.hexml
Class Parser

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.webcycle.hexml.Parser
public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object

A simple xml-like parser base class which uses a Trie data structure to recognize tag names and map them to java classes. This results is a tree of objects. Subclasses must implement the Parser Trie via getvocab().

Constructor Detail

Parser

public Parser()
Method Detail

isCaseSensitive

public boolean isCaseSensitive()
whether tag case is part of tag matching

setCaseSensitive

public void setCaseSensitive(boolean cs)
set whether to pay attention to the case of tags when parsing.

the following is no longer implemented: can only be set if the parse trie is null (ie it has not yet been created) or if it has no entries. If the parser is set to ignore case, then the parser vocabulary is built with uppercase tag names (unless your parser subclass overrides insertVocabEntry().)

Note regardless of tag matching case sensitivity, stored tag names will always be the exact text from the input file.

See Also:
insertVocabEntry

setStream

public void setStream(java.io.BufferedInputStream bis)
Set the internal input stream, used by subsequent calls to parse(). Note that load() sets it internally.

load

public void load(iParseContext context,
                 java.lang.String fname)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 java.io.IOException
Read an object from the given filename by creating an empty iCollection and parsing from a new filestream created with the given name. Sets the internal input stream source, to be referenced within parse(). Sets currentFile to point to the file openend for reading by parse(). Sets source to null when completed.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if read() fails
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if fname is not found.

load

public void load(iParseContext context,
                 java.io.File f)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 java.io.IOException
Parse from the given File by passing thru to load(String) via File.getPath().
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if read() fails
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if fname is not found.
See Also:
File.getPath()

parse

public void parse(iParseContext context)
           throws java.io.IOException
Parse from Scan for the character '<' and invoke subParse() at that point in the stream.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if read() fails
